hero.name: Dillon Khanna
hero.description: Building robust, scalable systems that translate complex ideas into real-world impact. I work across the full technology stack, from AI experiments to production infrastructure, always focused on creating tools that solve meaningful problems.

techFocus.headline: Building with a modern, scalable toolchain.
techFocus.summary: Focused on shipping resilient platforms with thoughtfully selected technology.

projects.title: AI Document Management Platform
projects.summary: A RAG pipeline that transforms unstructured user documentation into a private, conversational knowledge base.
projects.result: 95% reduction in manual data entry across pilot teams

detailSections.title: Technical Feat
detailSections.body: Event-driven retrieval augmented generation pipeline on GCP with chunk-level security enforcement.

detailSections.title: Problem Statement
detailSections.body: Teams needed natural-language access to regulated documents without exposing data to shared or public indexes.

detailSections.title: What I Built
detailSections.body: Serverless ingestion network that normalizes documents, orchestrates embeddings, and streams grounded responses with inline citations.

projects.title: Tauri Local Search App
projects.summary: A private desktop app that performs semantic search over local files without sending data to the cloud.
projects.result: Sub-50ms semantic retrieval on commodity hardware

detailSections.title: Technical Feat
detailSections.body: On-device embeddings pipeline powered by Rust and an optimized ONNX runtime.

detailSections.title: Problem Statement
detailSections.body: Knowledge workers wanted AI-assisted recall for documents stored locally, while keeping content air-gapped.

detailSections.title: What I Built
detailSections.body: Cross-platform desktop UI with background sync, vector index compaction, and fuzzy ranking tuned for short-form notes.

projects.title: Incident Co-Pilot
projects.summary: Internal reliability tool that surfaces runbooks, metrics, and past remediation steps during live incidents.
projects.result: 40% faster incident resolution at peak load

detailSections.title: Technical Feat
detailSections.body: Realtime aggregation layer that fuses observability streams with conversational search.

detailSections.title: Problem Statement
detailSections.body: On-call engineers were context switching across dashboards and docs, slowing down response times during outages.

detailSections.title: What I Built
detailSections.body: Unified console with adaptive prompts, runbook snippets, and auto-generated post-incident timelines.

workExperience.heading: Work Experience
workExperience.subheading: Recent roles where I paired strong engineering with collaborative teams.

entries.summary: Engineering AI and data systems across healthcare and content platforms with a focus on reliability and semantics.
impact: Built an Autogen + Azure OpenAI agent that maps proprietary models to HL7 FHIR with ~30% fully accurate mappings, lifting analyst throughput.
Shipped a resilient C# ETL that migrated 5M+ OpenText docs into SharePoint with throttled batching, retries, and secure transfer.
Designed semantic metadata search to align internal column names to FHIR concepts using vector indexing.

entries.summary: Built validation tooling to de-risk controller migrations and accelerate field upgrades.
impact: Automated round-trip schema validation to catch mapping regressions ahead of deployment windows.
Owned a test harness that unlocked faster iterations for a field-facing migration tool.

entries.summary: Supported BI curriculum; evaluated Tableau/PowerBI dashboards and coached on data modeling.
impact: Standardized rubrics alongside faculty to improve grading consistency across sections.
Mentored students on DAX measures and dimensional modeling fundamentals.

principles.title: Scale Through Simplicity
principles.description: The most scalable systems follow simple patterns applied consistently. Complex architectures often collapse under their own weight—elegant ones adapt and grow.
